results.title: Essence of life
results.brief_description: Explains and illustrates the main characteristics of a living organism - the ability to reproduce its own species, response to stimuli, movement and metabolism. Studies different forms of life developed on earth as conditions altered, from fresh water to dry land - fish, amphibia, birds, insects, animals and plants.

results.title: ESPN Super bouts. Vol. 12
results.brief_description: Features the rematch between Marvin Hagler, existing Middleweight championship holder and Vito Antuofermo with whom he drew in 1979 when Antuofermo was reigning champion. The action is picked up in round 2, live from The Boston Garden, Boston, Massachusetts, June 13, 1981 where Hagler is victorious. Also features a bout at The Rosemont Horizon, Rosemont, Illinois, October 10, 1981, where Hagler beats Mustaffa Hamsho in a TKO. Includes a match debrief by Al Bernstein and Sam Smith.

results.title: ESPN Super bouts. Vol. 11
results.brief_description: Features the 1979 World Middleweight Championship bout between Marvellous Marvin Hagler and defending champion Vito Antuofermo at Ceasar’s Palace, Las Vegas, Nevada, November 1979. It was a case of Hagler’s strength against the heart of mauler and brawler Antuofermo. The bout resulted in a 15 round draw. Includes a match debrief by Al Bernstein and Sam Smith.

results.title: Especially the children
results.brief_description: In the developing world, simple survival is the basic need for many children and their families. UNICEF seeks for all children the basic rights and privileges set forth in the Declaration of the Rights of the Child.

results.title: Eskimo hunters
results.creator_credit: W. Kay Norton and Louis de Rochemont Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth and it’s peoples”.
Describes the life of the Eskimos of north-western Alaska, 25,000 of whom live in scattered villages in a region in which the winters are six months long.

results.title: Eskimo children
results.creator_credit: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A study of an Eskimo family living on Nunivak Island, off the Alaskan coast, showing how the Eskimo people solve the problem of providing food, clothing, shelter, and transport for themselves. Today the results of the contacts made with the outside world can be seen in the changing customs of the Eskimo people.

results.title: Escape from Woomera
results.brief_description: Escape from Woomera is a videogame that asks players to experience Australia’s draconian immigration policies from the point-of-view of a refugee. By combining game mechanics, art and activism, Escape from Woomera goes beyond the razor wire and detention centre media blackout.

constellations_other.name: Access to resistance
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores how access to new recording devices has inspired guerilla filmmaking and protest, helping challenge cultural, societal and political norms.

results.description:
If you thought escaping from Castle Wolfenstein was hard, try Woomera Immigration Reception and Processing Centre…

With a first person, 3D adventure game we invite gamers to assume the character of, and ‘live’ through the experiences of a modern day refugee. The effective media lock-out from immigration detention centres has meant that the whole truth about what goes on behind the razor-wire at Woomera, Baxter, Port Hedland, Maribyrnong and Villawood remains largely a mystery to the Australian public. We want to challenge this by offering the world a glimpse - more than that even: an interactive, immersive experience - of life within the most secretive and controversial places on the Australian political and geographical landscape. In this way, Escape From Woomera will be an engine for mobilising experiences and situations otherwise inaccessible to an nation of disempowered onlookers. It will provide both a portal and a toolkit for reworking and engaging with what is otherwise an entirely mediated current affair.

Lead artist/Environment artist: Stephen Honegger

Level designer: Ian Malcolm

Investigative journalist: Kate Wild

Cutscene artist: Morgan Simpson

Creative director: Katharine Neil

Animators: Andrea Blundell, Chris Markwart

Producers: Justin Halliday, Mark Angeli

Executive producer: Julian Oliver

Admin: Rani Kellock

Programming: Matthew Jones, David Jewsbury, Duncan Murray

Additional programming: Katharine Neil

UI art and website: Monique Jones

QA: Alex McNeilly

results.title: Escape from the sea
results.creator_credit: A. Frank Bundy, Wallace Productions and Peter Seabourne
results.brief_description: A film designed for a youthful audience depicting the adventures of a boy about 12 years old who gets into difficulty in the sea in his rubber dingy. He is rescued by a scouting group who then have problems when their leader is hit by falling rocks. He in turn is rescued by helicopter. Filmed on the foreshores of Cornwall this is a “safety” film showing the work of the Royal Naval Rescue Service and HM Coastguard.
